title: Supreme Court (Review of Judgments and Orders) Act, 2023
title_en: Supreme Court (Review of Judgments and Orders) Act, 2023
description: Official consolidated text of Supreme Court (Review of Judgments and Orders) Act, 2023 (XXIII of 2023) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws).

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title, commencement and extent
provisions.content:
(1) This Act shall be called the Supreme
Court (Review of Judgments and Orders) Act, 2023.
(2)    It shall come into force at once.

provisions.title: Section 2. Enlargement of jurisdiction of the Supreme Court
provisions.content:
In case of judgments and
orders of the Supreme Court in exercise of its original jurisdiction under Article 184 of the
Constitution, the scope of review on both facts and law, shall be the same as an appeal under Article
185 of the Constitution.

provisions.title: Section 3. Larger Bench
provisions.content:
A review petition shall be heard by a Bench larger than the Bench
which passed the original judgment or order.

provisions.title: Section 4. Right to appoint counsel
provisions.content:
The review petitioner shall have the right to appoint any
advocate of the Supreme Court of his choice for the review petition.

provisions.title: Section 5. Judgments and orders made prior to commencement of this Act
provisions.content:
The right to file
a review petition shall also be available to an aggrieved person against whom an order has been made
under-clause (3) of Article 184 of the Constitution, prior to the commencement of this Act:
Provided that the review petition under this section shall be filed within sixty days of the
commencement of this Act.

provisions.title: Section 6. Limitation
provisions.content:
A review petition may be filed within sixty days of the passing of the
original order.

provisions.title: Section 7. Act to override other laws etc
provisions.content:
The provisions of this Act shall have effect
notwithstanding anything contained in any other law, rules or regulations for the time being in force
or judgment of any court including the Supreme Court and a High Court.
